results.title: Flying over the Shoalhaven River
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 18 of Series “The Australian eye IV”.
Margaret Preston was one of the few artists who have attempted to absorb the spirit of Australian aboriginal art into Modernist painting. “Flying over the Shoalhaven River” is one of the best of her paintings influenced by the ancient art of this country. The film examines some of the artist’s work, and her thoughts on “National Art”, design and theories of light and colour are also elaborated.

results.title: Flying Dutchmen
results.creator_credit: Steve Westh, Stuart Menzies, Tony Wright and December Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Grey voyagers”.
65 year old Jan van Hulsen teams up Fred van`t Riet to sail a 37 foot yacht from Guatemala to Australia. Hindered by poor weather, delays and clashes of opinion, they don’t travel much further than the Caribbean. Still grieving the recent death of his wife, Jan perseveres through the loneliness and hardship to chart a new direction in his life.

results.title: Flying careers with the Navy
results.brief_description: Illustrates aspects of the training of pilots for the Royal Australian Navy, showing how recruits gain experience handling Tiger Moth, Wirraway, Sea Fury and Fire-Fly types of aircraft. The film records joint Navy and Air Force exercises held off the NSW coast to test Australian defences against possible attack from sea and air.

results.title: Flying among the weeds
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence
results.brief_description: This video examines the risks of low flying by Australian army pilots, men trained to use the agility and mobility of frail, light aircraft on a battle field to help groundforces fight and win a battle. These men fly Bell 206B helicopters and Pelartus Porter and Nomad fixed wing planes.

results.title: Flyaway
results.brief_description: Contrasts the earthbound obstacle ridden path of a man with the free-flowing glide of a plane. A spectrum of animals is used to represent the earthbound, the semi-bound and the free. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Fly about the house
results.brief_description: Two flies hatch out and go off in search of food. They first visit a well-kept home; the dustbin is properly covered, the householders wash their hands frequently, the larder door is kept closed and the food in it is well-covered. Baulked here, they go on to a slovenly household, find lots of food lying about, sample it all. One fly goes back to the first house, is sprayed and killed. The other goes on to another dirty house and spreads disease and death An animated film.

results.title: Flux
results.brief_description: Director Michaela French uses 2-D animation, over-laying images and sound to create a narrative. A woman narrates over abstracted imagery relating her feelings of loss and grief, coming to terms with the death of a soul-mate in a recent car accident. What emerges is an exploration into grief itself. The narrator not only looks at her separation from her soul-mate, but asks questions about the change of her physical space as a result of their absence.
